intro: Eriogonum vestitum, commonly known as the dressed buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, clustered white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically covered in a fine, hairy layer, giving it a distinctive appearance. Eriogonum vestitum is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, often found in arid and semi-arid environments.
